intro: Scabiosa arvensis f. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous field scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caprifoliaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically features slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This variety is distinguished by its reduced pubescence, giving it a smoother appearance compared to other forms of Scabiosa arvensis. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and disturbed habitats.
